label: Study Identifier
IGcomment: Unique identifier for a study.

label: Domain Abbreviation
IGcomment: Four-character abbreviation for the domain, AP--.

label: Associated Persons Identifier
IGcomment: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons. If APID identifies a pool, POOLDEF records must exist for each associated person.

label: Sequence Number
IGcomment: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a domain for associated persons. Unique within APID within the domain.

label: Related Subject
IGcomment: Identifier for a related study subject or pool of study subjects. The subject(s) may be human or animal. RSUBJID will be populated with the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool. RSUBJID will be null for data about associated persons who are related to the study but not to any of the study subjects.

label: Related Device
IGcomment: Identifier for a related device. RDEVID will be populated with the SPDEVID of the related device.

label: Subject, Device, or Study Relationship
IGcomment: If RSUBJID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID. If RDEVID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the device identified in RDEVID. If RSUBJID and RDEVID are null, SREL describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the study identified in STUDYID.

label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
comment: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.
IGcomment: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.

label: Study Identifier
IGcomment: Unique identifier for a study.

label: Associated Persons Identifier
IGcomment: Identifier for a single associated person, a group of associated persons, or a pool of associated persons. If APID identifies a pool, POOLDEF records must exist for each associated person.

label: Related Subject or Pool Identifier
IGcomment: Identifier for a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID may be populated with the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool. RSUBJID will be null for data about associated persons who are related to the study but not to any study subjects.

label: Related Device Identifier
IGcomment: Identifier for a related device. RDEVID will be populated with the SPDEVID of the related device.

label: Subject, Device, or Study Relationship
IGcomment: If RSUBJID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID. If RDEVID is populated, describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the subject or pool identified in RDEVID. If RSUBJID and RDEVID are null, SREL describes the relationship of the associated person(s) identified in APID to the study identified in STUDYID.

label: Related Domain Abbreviation
comment: Domain abbreviations for domains which are related to at least one other domain. Derived from parent record
IGcomment: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). Null for comments collected on a general comments or additional information CRF page.

label: Identifying Variable
IGcomment: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies. Examples AESEQ or CMGRPID. Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

label: Identifying Variable Value
IGcomment: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

label: Comment Reference
comment: For comments originating from the sponsor source system, the COREF value starts with EDC_FORM_COMMENT
IGcomment: Sponsor-defined reference associated with the comment. May be the CRF page number (e.g. 650), or a module name (e.g. DEMOG), or a combination of information that identifies the reference (e.g. 650-VITALS-VISIT 2).

label: Comment
IGcomment: The text of the comment. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns COVAL1-COVALn. See Assumption 3.

label: Device Identifier Element Short Name
IGcomment: Short name of the identifier characteristic of the device. Examples: SERIAL, MODEL. A record with DIPARMCD = TYPE should be included (see below)

label: Device Identifier Element Name
IGcomment: Name of the identifier characteristic of the device. Examples: Serial Number, Model. A record with DIPARM = Type should be included (see below)

label: Device Identifier Element Value
IGcomment: Value for the parameter. Value for the parameter. When DIPARM = Type, DIVAL should be a value in the GMDN dictionary (see below)

label: Subject Identifier for the Study
IGcomment: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.

label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
comment: Set as date of first dose
IGcomment: First date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.

label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
comment: Set as date of last dose
IGcomment: Last date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).

label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
comment: If DS record exists with DSTERM=INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED then RFICDTC=DSSTDTC
IGcomment: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.

label: Date/Time of End of Participation
comment: Calculated as the maximum of last visit date, date of last dose, discontinuation date, last adverse event start date and date of screening failure
IGcomment: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, or death date.

label: Date/Time of Death
comment: If AE record exists with AEOUT=FATAL then DTHDTC=AEENDTC
IGcomment: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.

label: Subject Death Flag
comment: If AE record exists with AEOUT=FATAL then DTHFL=Y
IGcomment: Indicates the subject died. Should be Y or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.

label: Study Site Identifier
IGcomment: Unique identifier for a site within a study.

label: Investigator Identifier
IGcomment: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.

label: Investigator Name
IGcomment: Name of the investigator for a site.

label: Date/Time of Birth
IGcomment: Date/time of birth of the subject.

label: Age
comment: Age at start of trial
IGcomment: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).

label: Age Units
IGcomment: Units associated with AGE.

label: Sex
IGcomment: Sex of the subject.

label: Race
IGcomment: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2005) for guidance regarding the collection of race (http://www.fda.gov/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm126340.htm) See Assumption below regarding RACE.

label: Ethnicity
IGcomment: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2005) for guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (http://www.fda.gov/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm126340.htm).

label: Planned Arm Code
IGcomment: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two- character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.

label: Description of Planned Arm
IGcomment: Name of the Arm to which the subject was assigned.

label: Actual Arm Code
IGcomment: Code of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARMCD will be UNPLAN. Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of NOTTRT. Values should be "SCRNFAIL" for screen failures and "NOTASSGN" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials.

label: Description of Actual Arm
IGcomment: Description of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARM will be "Unplanned Treatment". Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of "Not Treated". Values should be "Screen Failure" for screen failures and "Not Assigned" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases.

label: Country
IGcomment: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial.

label: Epi/Pandemic Related Indicator
IGcomment: Non-standard Variable from Guidance for Ongoing Studies Disrupted by COVID-19 Pandemic Version 1.0

label: Reason for Deviation
IGcomment: Non-standard Variable from Guidance for Ongoing Studies Disrupted by COVID-19 Pandemic Version 1.0

label: ECG Beat Number
IGcomment: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG.

label: Reported Term
comment: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.
IGcomment: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.

label: Modified Reported Term
comment: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
IGcomment: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

label: Lowest Level Term
comment: MedDRA Lowest Level Term.
IGcomment: MedDRA Lowest Level Term.

label: Lowest Level Term Code
comment: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.
IGcomment: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.

label: Dictionary-Derived Term
comment: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of the topic variable, --TERM, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).
IGcomment: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of the topic variable, --TERM, or the modified topic variable (-- MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).

label: Preferred Term Code
comment: MedDRA Preferred Term code.
IGcomment: MedDRA Preferred Term code.

label: High Level Term
comment: MedDRA High Level Term from the primary path.
IGcomment: MedDRA High Level Term from the primary path.

label: High Level Term Code
comment: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.
IGcomment: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.

label: High Level Group Term
comment: MedDRA High Level Group Term from the primary path.
IGcomment: MedDRA High Level Group Term from the primary path.

label: High Level Group Term Code
comment: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.
IGcomment: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.

label: Category
comment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
IGcomment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

label: Subcategory
comment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
IGcomment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.

label: Pre-specified
comment: Used to indicate whether the event described by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events.
IGcomment: Used to indicate whether the event described by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events.

label: Occurrence
comment: Used to record whether a pre-specified event occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
IGcomment: Used to record whether a pre-specified event occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

label: Completion Status
comment: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre- specified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

label: Reason Not Done
comment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is NOT DONE.

label: Body System or Organ Class
comment: Body system or system organ class assigned for analysis from a standard hierarchy (e.g. MedDRA) associated with an event. Example: GASTROINTESTINAL DISORDERS.
IGcomment: Body system or system organ class assigned for analysis from a standard hierarchy (e.g. MedDRA) associated with an event. Example: GASTROINTESTINAL DISORDERS.

label: Body System or Organ Class Code
comment: MedDRA System Organ Class code corresponding to --BODSYS assigned for analysis.
IGcomment: MedDRA System Organ Class code corresponding to -- BODSYS assigned for analysis.

label: Primary System Organ Class
comment: MedDRA primary System Organ Class associated with the event.
IGcomment: MedDRA primary System Organ Class associated with the event.

label: Primary System Organ Class Code
comment: MedDRA primary System Organ Class code.
IGcomment: MedDRA primary System Organ Class code.

label: Location of Event
comment: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event. Example: ARM for skin rash.
IGcomment: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event. Example: ARM for skin rash.

label: Laterality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality. Examples: RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL

label: Directionality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL

label: Portion or Totality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of. Examples: ENTIRE, SINGLE, SEGMENT, MANY.

label: Accountable Party
IGcomment: Party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. device, specimen) as a result of the activity performed in the associated --TERM variable. The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the -- PRTYID variable.

label: Identification of Accountable Party
IGcomment: Identification of the specific party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. device, specimen) after the action in -- TERM is taken. Used in conjunction with --PARTY.

label: Severity/Intensity
comment: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.
IGcomment: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.

label: Serious Event
comment: Is this is a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Is this is a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
comment: Describes changes made to the study treatment as a result of the event. Examples: DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED.
IGcomment: Describes changes made to the study treatment as a result of the event. Examples: DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED.

label: Other Action Taken
comment: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment.
IGcomment: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment.

label: Action Taken with Device
IGcomment: Action taken with respect to a device in a study, which may or may not be the device under study

label: Causality
comment: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED.
IGcomment: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED.

label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
comment: An opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE."
IGcomment: An opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE."

label: Pattern of Event
comment: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.
IGcomment: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.

label: Outcome of Event
comment: Description of the outcome of an event. Examples: RECOVERED/RESOLVED, FATAL.
IGcomment: Description of the outcome of an event. Examples: RECOVERED/RESOLVED, FATAL.

label: Involves Cancer
comment: Was the event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Was the event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
comment: Was the event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Was the event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
comment: Did the event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Did the event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Results in Death
comment: Did the event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Did the event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
comment: Did the event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Did the event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Is Life Threatening
comment: Was the event life threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Was the event life threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Occurred with Overdose
comment: Did the event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Did the event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
comment: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
comment: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
IGcomment: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

label: Toxicity
comment: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.
IGcomment: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define- XML document.

label: Toxicity Grade
comment: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.
IGcomment: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define- XML document.

label: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
comment: Short character value for --TEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: PLAT, SYSBP, RRMIN, EYEEXAM.
IGcomment: Short character value for --TEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: PLAT, SYSBP, RRMIN, EYEEXAM.

label: Repetition Number
IGcomment: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.

label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
comment: Long name For --TESTCD. Examples: Platelet, Systolic Blood Pressure, Summary (Min) RR Duration, Eye Examination.
IGcomment: Long name For --TESTCD. Examples: Platelet, Systolic Blood Pressure, Summary (Min) RR Duration, Eye Examination.

label: Modified Term
comment: If the value of --ORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
IGcomment: If the value of --ORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
IGcomment: Further description of --TESTCD and --TEST. Example: "The percentage of cells with +1 intensity of staining" when MITESTCD = TTF1.

label: Category
comment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: HEMATOLOGY, URINALYSIS, CHEMISTRY, HAMILTON DEPRESSION SCALE, SF36.
IGcomment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: HEMATOLOGY, URINALYSIS, CHEMISTRY, HAMILTON DEPRESSION SCALE, SF36, MICRO ARRAY, EGFR MUTATION ANALYSIS

label: Subcategory
comment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values. Example: DIFFERENTIAL.
IGcomment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values. Example: DIFFERENTIAL.

label: Position of Subject During Observation
comment: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: SUPINE, STANDING, SITTING.
IGcomment: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: SUPINE, STANDING, SITTING.

label: Body System or Organ Class
comment: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results. Example: MedDRA SOC.
IGcomment: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results. Example: MedDRA SOC.

label: Result or Finding in Original Units
comment: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: 120, <1, POS.
IGcomment: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: 120, <1, POS.

label: Original Units
comment: Unit for --ORRES. Examples: IN, LB, kg/L.
IGcomment: Unit for --ORRES. Examples: IN, LB, kg/L.

label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
comment: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.
IGcomment: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.

label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
comment: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.
IGcomment: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.

label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
comment: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from --ORRES in a standard format or in standard units. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".
IGcomment: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from --ORRES in a standard format or in standard units. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in -- STRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".

label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
comment: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
IGcomment: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

label: Standard Units
comment: Standardized units used for --STRESC and --STRESN. Example: mol/L.
IGcomment: Standardized units used for --STRESC and --STRESN. Example: mol/L.

label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
comment: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).
IGcomment: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).

label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
comment: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).
IGcomment: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).

label: Normal Range for Character Results
comment: Normal range or reference range for results stored in --STRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: Negative to Trace.
IGcomment: Normal range or reference range for results stored in --STRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: Negative to Trace.

label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
comment: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by --ORNRLO and --ORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL; ABNORMAL.
IGcomment: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by --ORNRLO and --ORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL; ABNORMAL.

label: Result Category
comment: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Example: MALIGNANT or BENIGN for tumor findings.
IGcomment: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Example: MALIGNANT or BENIGN for tumor findings. RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation.

label: Completion Status
comment: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

label: Reason Not Done
comment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.

label: External File Path
comment: Filename for an external file, such as one for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
IGcomment: Filename for an external file, such as one for an ECG waveform or a medical image.

label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
comment: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
IGcomment: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

label: LOINC Code
comment: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.
IGcomment: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.

label: Specimen Material Type
comment: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE.
IGcomment: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE, DNA, RNA.

label: Anatomical Region
IGcomment: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol, such as a section or part of what is described in the --SPEC variable. Examples: CORTEX, MEDULLA, MUCOSA

label: Specimen Condition
comment: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: CLOUDY.
IGcomment: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: CLOUDY.

label: Specimen Usability for the Test
comment: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be N if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.
IGcomment: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be N if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.

label: Location Used for the Measurement
comment: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: RECTAL for temperature, ARM for blood pressure.
IGcomment: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: RECTAL for temperature, ARM for blood pressure.

label: Laterality
comment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL

label: Directionality
comment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL

label: Portion or Totality
comment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of. . Examples: ENTIRE, SINGLE, SEGMENT, MANY.
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of. . Examples: ENTIRE, SINGLE, SEGMENT, MANY.

label: Method of Test or Examination
comment: Method of the test or examination. Examples: EIA (Enzyme Immunoassay), ELECTROPHORESIS, DIPSTICK
IGcomment: Method of the test or examination. Examples: EIA (Enzyme Immunoassay), ELECTROPHORESIS, DIPSTICK

label: Run ID
IGcomment: A unique identifier for a particular run of a test on a particular batch of samples.

label: Analysis Method
IGcomment: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g. an image or a genetic sequence).

label: Lead Identified to Collect Measurements
comment: Lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument. Examples: LEAD I, LEAD V2, LEAD CM5.
IGcomment: Lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument. Examples: LEAD I, LEAD V2, LEAD CM5.

label: Consciousness State
comment: The consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: CONSCIOUS, SEMI-CONSCIOUS, UNCONSCIOUS
IGcomment: The consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: CONSCIOUS, SEMI-CONSCIOUS, UNCONSCIOUS

label: Baseline Flag
comment: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null.
IGcomment: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null.

label: Fasting Status
comment: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include Y, N, U or null if not relevant.
IGcomment: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include Y, N, U or null if not relevant.

label: Derived Flag
comment: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be Y or null.
IGcomment: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be Y or null.

label: Evaluator
comment: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR, RADIOLOGIST.
IGcomment: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR, RADIOLOGIST.

label: Evaluator Identifier
comment: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: RADIOLOGIST1 or RADIOLOGIST2
IGcomment: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: RADIOLOGIST1 or RADIOLOGIST2

label: Accepted Record Flag
comment: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be Y or null.
IGcomment: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be Y or null.

label: Toxicity
comment: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.
IGcomment: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define- XML document.

label: Toxicity Grade
comment: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define data definition document. Example: 2.
IGcomment: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define data definition document. Example: 2.

label: Severity
comment: Describes the severity or intensity of a particular finding. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.
IGcomment: Describes the severity or intensity of a particular finding. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.

label: Relationship to Death
IGcomment: Describes the relationship of a particular finding to the death of a subject. Examples: Y, N or U.

label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
comment: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.
IGcomment: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.

label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
IGcomment: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.

label: Exclude from Statistics
IGcomment: Indicates whether the values in the result variables for this record should be excluded from summary statistical calculations such as Mean, Standard Deviation, and Count (and others). Expected to be Y or null. --EXCLFL should not be used when - -STAT is NOT DONE. Not to be used with human clinical trials.

label: Reason for Exclusion from Statistics
IGcomment: Reason excluded from statistics. Used in conjunction with -- EXCLFL when its value is Y. Not to be used with human clinical trials

label: Object of the Observation
comment: Used in domains modeled as Findings About Events or Findings About Interventions. Describes the event or intervention whose property is being measured in --TESTCD/--TEST. Example: an event of vomiting which has findings, where --OBJ = "VOMIT" and the volume of VOMIT is being measured where --TESTCD = "VOLUME".
IGcomment: Used in domains modeled as Findings About Events or Findings About Interventions. Describes the event or intervention whose property is being measured in --TESTCD/--TEST. Example: an event of vomiting which has findings, where --OBJ = "VOMIT" and the volume of VOMIT is being measured where --TESTCD = "VOLUME".

label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
IGcomment: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

label: Repetition Number
IGcomment: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.

label: Study Identifier
comment: Unique identifier for a study.
IGcomment: Unique identifier for a study.

label: Domain Abbreviation
comment: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The Domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.
IGcomment: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The Domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.

label: Unique Subject Identifier
comment: Concatenation of STUDYID and DM.SUBJID
IGcomment: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

label: Pool Identifier
comment: An identifier used to identify a result from a group of subjects that is not assignable to a specific subject.
IGcomment: An identifier used to identify a result from a group of subjects that is not assignable to a specific subject.

label: Sponsor Device Identifier
IGcomment: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device

label: Sequence Number
comment: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
IGcomment: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

label: Group ID
comment: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset (Section 3.4).
IGcomment: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset (Section 3.4).

label: Reference ID
comment: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID, or UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.
IGcomment: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID, or UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.

label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
comment: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.
IGcomment: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.

label: Link ID
comment: Identifier used to link a feature (such as a tumor) initially recorded as a result in one findings domain to assessments of that feature in another findings domain. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For Example: A single tumor may have multiple measurements/assessment performed at each study visit.
IGcomment: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to- one or a one-to-many relationship. For Example: A single tumor may have multiple measurements/assessments performed at each study visit.

label: Link Group ID
comment: A grouping identifier used to identify a group of assessment results in one domain that are evaluated, as a group, and contribute to a (summary) result in another domain. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. For example: Multiple tumor measurements/assessments will contribute to a single response to therapy determination record.
IGcomment: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. For example: Multiple tumor measurements/assessments will contribute to a single response to therapy determination record.

label: Element Code
IGcomment: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

label: Description of Element
IGcomment: The name of the Element.

label: Name of Treatment
comment: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.
IGcomment: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.

label: Modified Treatment Name
comment: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
IGcomment: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

label: Standardized Treatment Name
comment: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of the topic variable, --TRT, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.
IGcomment: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of the topic variable, -- TRT, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.

label: Mood
IGcomment: Mode or condition of the record (e.g., SCHEDULED, PERFORMED).

label: Category
comment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
IGcomment: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

label: Subcategory
comment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
IGcomment: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.

label: Pre-specified
comment: Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.
IGcomment: Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.

label: Occurrence
comment: Used to record whether a pre-specified intervention occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
IGcomment: Used to record whether a pre-specified intervention occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.

label: Completion Status
comment: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre- specified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

label: Reason Not Done
comment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.
IGcomment: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.

label: Indication
comment: Denotes the indication for the intervention (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered).
IGcomment: Denotes the indication for the intervention (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered).

label: Class
comment: Class for a medication or treatment, often obtained from a coding dictionary.
IGcomment: Class for a medication or treatment, often obtained from a coding dictionary.

label: Class Code
comment: Used to represent code for --CLAS.
IGcomment: Used to represent code for --CLAS.

label: Dose
comment: Amount of --TRT given. Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.
IGcomment: Amount of --TRT given. Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.

label: Dose Description
comment: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: <1 per day, 200-400. Not populated when --DOSE is populated.
IGcomment: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: <1 per day, 200-400. Not populated when --DOSE is populated.

label: Dose Units
comment: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT (Examples: ng, mg, mg/kg).
IGcomment: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT (Examples: ng, mg, mg/kg).

label: Dose Form
comment: Dose form for the treatment. Examples: TABLET, CAPSULE.
IGcomment: Dose form for the treatment. Examples: TABLET, CAPSULE.

label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
comment: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval. Examples: QD, BID, TID, QID.
IGcomment: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval. Examples: Q2H, QD, PRN.

label: Total Daily Dose
comment: Total daily dose of --TRT using the units in --DOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose.
IGcomment: Total daily dose of --TRT using the units in --DOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose.

label: Intended Dose Regimen
comment: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.
IGcomment: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.

label: Route of Administration
comment: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.
IGcomment: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.

label: Lot Number
comment: Lot number for the intervention described in --TRT.
IGcomment: Lot number for the intervention described in --TRT.

label: Location of Dose Administration
comment: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site. Example: ARM for an injection.
IGcomment: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site. Example: ARM for an injection.

label: Laterality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration. Examples: RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL

label: Directionality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality of intervention administration. Examples: ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL

label: Portion or Totality
IGcomment: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of the intervention administration. Examples: ENTIRE, SINGLE, SEGMENT, MANY.

label: Fasting Status
IGcomment: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include Y, N, U or null if not relevant.

label: Pharmaceutical Strength
IGcomment: Amount of an active ingredient expressed quantitatively per dosage unit, per unit of volume, or per unit of weight, according to the pharmaceutical dose form. Example: 50 mg/TABLET, 300 mg/L

label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
IGcomment: Unit for --PSTRG. Example: mg/TABLET, mg/mL

label: Treatment Vehicle
comment: Vehicle for administration of treatment, such as a liquid in which the treatment drug is dissolved. Example: SALINE.
IGcomment: Vehicle for administration of treatment, such as a liquid in which the treatment drug is dissolved. Example: SALINE.

label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
comment: Amount of the treatment vehicle administered or given.
IGcomment: Amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given. Note: should not be diluent amount alone.

label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
comment: Units for the treatment vehicle. Examples: mL, mg.
IGcomment: Units for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle). Examples: mL, mg.

label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
comment: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples ADVERSE EVENT, INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE, NON-MEDICAL REASON.
IGcomment: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples ADVERSE EVENT, INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE, NON-MEDICAL REASON.

label: Repetition Number
IGcomment: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.

label: Visit Name
comment: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
IGcomment: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

label: Visit Number
comment: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
IGcomment: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

label: Planned Study Day of Visit
comment: Based on TV.VISITDY
IGcomment: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

label: Unique Subject Identifier
comment: Concatenation of STUDYID and DM.SUBJID (This is a variable for internal system use)
IGcomment: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

label: Element Code
comment: Set based on the SE domain
IGcomment: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

label: Description of Element
comment: Set based on the SE domain
IGcomment: The name of the Element.

label: Epi/Pandemic Related Adjustment Reas Ind
IGcomment: Non-standard Variable from Guidance for Ongoing Studies Disrupted by COVID-19 Pandemic Version 1.0

label: Epi/Pandemic Related Discontin Reas Ind
IGcomment: Non-standard Variable from Guidance for Ongoing Studies Disrupted by COVID-19 Pandemic Version 1.0

label: Epi/Pandemic Related Indicator
IGcomment: Non-standard Variable from Guidance for Ongoing Studies Disrupted by COVID-19 Pandemic Version 1.0

label: Study Identifier
IGcomment: Unique identifier for a study

label: Related Domain Abbreviation
comment: Domain abbreviations for domains which are related to at least one other domain. Derived from parent record
IGcomment: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s)

label: Unique Subject Identifier
comment: Concatenation of STUDYID and DM.SUBJID
IGcomment: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

label: Identifying Variable
comment: Derived from parent record
IGcomment: Name of the identifying variable in the general- observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples include --SEQ and --GRPID.

label: Identifying Variable Value
comment: Derived from parent record
IGcomment: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ would be entered here.

label: Relationship Type
IGcomment: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either ONE or MANY. Used only when identifying a relationship between datasets (as described in Section 8.3).

label: Relationship Identifier
comment: Records with the same RELID value can be considered as related records
IGcomment: Unique value within USUBJID that identifies the relationship. All records for the same USUBJID that have the same RELID are considered "related/associated." RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated Domain records.

label: Description of Unplanned Element
IGcomment: Description of what happened to the subject during this unplanned Element. Used only if ETCD has the value of "UNPLAN".

label: Element Code
IGcomment: 1. ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. 2. If an encountered Element differs from the planned Element to the point that it is considered a new Element, then use "UNPLAN" as the value for ETCD to represent this Element.

label: Description of Element
IGcomment: The name of the Element. If ETCD has a value of "UNPLAN" then ELEMENT should be Null.

label: Study Identifier
IGcomment: Study Identifier of the Parent record(s).

label: Related Domain Abbreviation
comment: Domain abbreviations for domains which are related to at least one other domain. Derived from parent record
IGcomment: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).

label: Sponsor Device Identifier
IGcomment: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device

label: Unique Subject Identifier
comment: Concatenation of STUDYID and DM.SUBJID
IGcomment: Unique Subject Identifier of the Parent record(s).

label: Identifying Variable
IGcomment: Identifying variable in the dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.

label: Identifying Variable Value
IGcomment: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s).

label: Qualifier Variable Name
IGcomment: The short name of the Qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset.

label: Qualifier Variable Label
IGcomment: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset.

label: Data Value
IGcomment: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in SUPP-- with a null value for QVAL.

label: Origin
IGcomment: Since QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples include CRF, ASSIGNED, or DERIVED. See Section 4: 4.1.1.8, Origin Metadata.

label: Evaluator
IGcomment: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Some examples include ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, STATISTICIAN, DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR, CLINICAL COORDINATOR, etc.

label: Description of Unplanned Visit
IGcomment: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned visit.

label: Planned Arm Code
IGcomment: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than that for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.

label: Description of Planned Arm
IGcomment: Name given to an Arm or treatment group.

label: Element Code
comment: Set based on the SE domain
IGcomment: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

label: Description of Element
comment: Set based on the SE domain
IGcomment: The name of the Element. The same Element may occur more than once within an Arm.

label: Branch
IGcomment: Condition subject met, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this Element, to be included in this Arm; (e.g., randomization to DRUG X).

label: Transition Rule
IGcomment: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an Element other than the next Element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other Elements, and the alternative Element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., Responders go to washout).

label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule
IGcomment: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial.

label: Anchor Variable Name
IGcomment: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be a referenced from the ADaM ADSL dataset e.g. ANCH1DT. Note: TDANCVAR will contain the name of a reference date variable.

label: Offset from the Anchor
IGcomment: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be either zero or a positive value and will be represented in ISO 8601 character format.

label: Planned Assessment Interval
IGcomment: The planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum
IGcomment: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum
IGcomment: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments
IGcomment: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g. assessments occur until death) TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis, encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.

label: Rule for Start of Element
IGcomment: Expresses rule for beginning Element.

label: Rule for End of Element
IGcomment: Expresses rule for ending Element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each Element.

label: Description of Element
IGcomment: The name of the Element.

label: Element Code
IGcomment: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule
IGcomment: Rule that expresses the criterion in computer-executable form (see assumption 4 below).

label: Protocol Criteria Versions
IGcomment: The number of this version of the Inclusion/Exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only one version.

label: Visit Number
comment: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
IGcomment: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

label: Visit Name
comment: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
IGcomment: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

label: Planned Study Day of Visit
comment: Based on TV.VISITDY
IGcomment: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
comment: Number that gives the planned order of the Element within the Arm (see Trial Arms, Section 3.2.2 ).
IGcomment: Number that gives the planned order of the Element within the Arm (see Trial Arms, Section 3.2.2 ).

label: Epoch
comment: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. (See Section 3.2.2).
IGcomment: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. (See Section 3.2.2).

label: Date/Time of Collection
comment: Collection date and time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
IGcomment: Collection date and time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

label: Start Date/Time of Observation
comment: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
IGcomment: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

label: End Date/Time of Observation
comment: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
IGcomment: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
comment: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
IGcomment: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

label: Study Day of Start of Observation
comment: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
IGcomment: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

label: Study Day of End of Observation
comment: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
IGcomment: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

label: Duration
comment: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
IGcomment: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

label: Planned Time Point Name
comment: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
IGcomment: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See --TPTNUM and -- TPTREF.

label: Planned Time Point Number
comment: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
IGcomment: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
comment: Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
IGcomment: Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

label: Time Point Reference
comment: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
IGcomment: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.

label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
comment: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
IGcomment: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

label: Start Relative to Reference Period
comment: Identifies the start of the observation as being before, during, or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.
IGcomment: Identifies the start of the observation as being before, during, or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics. Note: This variable will be deprecated (phased out) in a future (post SDTM v1.4) release. The functionality of this variable can be replaced by the use of - -STRTPT with --STTPT = RFSTDTC.

label: End Relative to Reference Period
comment: Identifies the end of the observation as being before, during or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.
IGcomment: Identifies the end of the observation as being before, during or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics. Note: This variable will be deprecated (phased out) in a future (post SDTM v1.4) release. The functionality of this variable can be replaced by the use of - -ENRTPT with --ENTPT = RFENDTC.

label: Evaluation Interval
comment: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire such as SF-36.
IGcomment: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding -- TESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire such as SF-36.

label: Evaluation Interval Text
IGcomment: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: LIFETIME, LAST NIGHT, RECENTLY, OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS.

label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
comment: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.
IGcomment: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor- defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.

label: Start Reference Time Point
comment: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
IGcomment: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor- defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".

label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
comment: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --ENTPT.
IGcomment: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor- defined reference time point defined by variable --ENTPT.

label: End Reference Time Point
comment: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
IGcomment: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 or other character format of the sponsor- defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".

label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
IGcomment: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval in ISO 8601 character format relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).

label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
IGcomment: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval in ISO 8601 character format relative to the Time Point Reference (--TPTREF).

label: Time in Days to Detection
IGcomment: The number of days from the start of dosing to the earliest detection of a condition or pathogen.

label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name
IGcomment: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names. Examples: AGEMIN, AGEMAX

label: Trial Summary Parameter
IGcomment: Term for the Trial Summary Parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples Planned Minimum Age of Subjects, Planned Maximum Age of Subjects

label: Parameter Value
IGcomment: Value of TSPARM. Example: "ASTHMA" when TSPARM value is "Trial Indication". TSVAL can only be null when TSVALNF is populated. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn.

label: Parameter Null Flavor
IGcomment: Null flavor for the value of TSPARM, to be populated if and only if TSVAL is null.

label: Parameter Value Code
IGcomment: This is the code of the term in TSVAL. For example; 6CW7F3G59X is the code for Gabapentin, C49488 is the code for Y. The length of this variable can be longer than 8 to accommodate the length of the external terminology.

label: Name of the Reference Terminology
IGcomment: The name of the Reference Terminology from which TSVALCD is taken. For example; CDISC, SNOMED, ISO 8601.

label: Version of the Reference Terminology
IGcomment: The version number of the Reference Terminology, if applicable.

label: Planned Arm Code
IGcomment: 1.ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven- period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. 2. If the timing of Visits for a trial does not depend on which ARM a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.

label: Description of Planned Arm
IGcomment: 1. Name given to an Arm or Treatment Group. 2. If the timing of Visits for a trial does not depend on which Arm a subject is in, then Arm should be left blank.

label: Visit Start Rule
IGcomment: Rule describing when the Visit starts, in relation to the sequence of Elements.

label: Visit End Rule
IGcomment: Rule describing when the Visit ends, in relation to the sequence of Elements.
